document_data.name: Firedawn Cycle
document_data.mainbody:
The '''''Firedawn Cycle''''' was an epic song originating from the [[Wychlaran]] of [[Rashemen]]. {{quote|Lament the day that Narfell won, and woe to those were there,
When black wings rose among the char of fallen [[Shandaular]]
When Seven sang a mournful dirge within the hollow Shield,
Where restless dead lie still, waiting, to rise and serve again.
The Nentyarch's son, by sword and curse, to tower tall he strides,
At morning light, for Breath and Word, still there his fury came;
Though cold he found among the fire, he mourned forgotten Flame.
Within the walls, inside the halls; to speak the Word that no one heard,
Of the Shield and break its silence.
Of the Shield and break its silence.|An excerpt from the ''Firedawn Cycle'', canto XII}}
document_data.Contents:
The ''Firedawn Cycle'' was described as a lengthy, chanted song with an eerie quality.

The epic told of the ascension of [[Raumathar]] as a power in the [[Unapproachable East|east]]. It detailed the people's collective lust for machines of war and their downfall as caused by the [[demon]]-worshiping [[Narfell]]i.

The ''Firedawn Cycle'' was rarely if ever, heard by non-[[Rashemaar]] and never inscribed in written records.
